magpie.models.regression

Class ClassificationRegression

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.models.BaseModel
      • magpie.models.regression.BaseRegression
        • magpie.models.regression.ClassificationRegression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, AbstractRegressionModel, Citable, Commandable, Options, Printable, Savable

    public class ClassificationRegression
extends BaseRegression
    Use a classification algorithm to perform regression. This method works by spliting all training examples into two sets: one where the class variable is past a threshold and one where it is not. This threshold is set by specifying the objective algorithm (with an BaseEntryRanker) and the treshold on which to split the data.

    Regression is performed by predicting that an entry 100% probability of being past the threshold to have a class variable equal to that of the training entry farthest past the threshold, 0% probability being equivalent to the entry farthest before the threshold, and all others linearly interpolated between those two.

    Usage: $<classifier> <threshold> <objective function> [<o.f. options...>]
    classifier: BaseModel that fills AbstractClassifier, used to make predictions
    threshold: Desired threshold for the objective function value
    objective function: BaseEntryRanker used to rank the entries based on their class variable. ("?" to list all available options)
    o.f. options: Any options for the objective function

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
